channel.title: Error help please
channel.description:
I get this error.
My friend and I are trying to program a new server, and yet I get this error and he doesn't.

item.title: Error help please
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

Yes =/

I even deleted the whole Array, and it still gives me the same error.

I think it’s because of my computer’s language.

The MS949 bit

My computer’s default language is set to Korean =/

Thanks for the help

Read full topic

item.title: Error help please
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Is it still giving you an error saying you have an unclosed string literal? Because that code looks fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Error help please
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

public String Illegal[] = {"~", "_", "!", "@", "#", "$", "(", ")", ";", "'", ",", ".", "/", "?", ":", "[", "{", "]", "}", "|", "%", "^", "&", "*"};

I don’t think there should be anything wrong =/

Ugh

Read full topic

item.title: Error help please
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“kiwon, post:3, topic:251933”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=332647.msg2594523#msg2594523 date=1229921839]
Unclosed String literal. You’re missing a quotation mark.

Edit: It seems as though you’re trying to set up an array of illegal characters for names.
Breaking a character’s name down to a char array and looping through each character identifying it as an illegal character with the isLetterOrDigit method would be much cleaner. Don’t forget to allow spaces in names, though. Lol.
[/quote]

Thanks but what I don’t get is, I sent my friend the exact same coding, and he doesn’t get the error.

=/[/quote]
That’s not possible, since you’re clearly missing a quote after that last question mark.

[quote=“kiwon, post:5, topic:251933”]I know what a quotation mark is -.-

There aren’t any missing though

I’ve triple checked.[/quote]
Ha, sorry. I misread what you said. My bad.
Yeah, look at the end of the array after the question mark.

Read full topic

Breaking a character’s name down to a char array and looping through each character identifying it as an illegal character with the isLetterOrDigit method would be much cleaner. Don’t forget to allow spaces in names, though. Lol.
